org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.tigr.tasm

Class TasmFileWriterBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.tigr.tasm.TasmFileWriterBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<TasmWriter>

    public final class TasmFileWriterBuilder
extends Object
implements Builder<TasmWriter>
    TasmFileWriterBuilder builds a TasmWriter using which has been configured by the the parameters given to its various methods.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Detail

      • TasmFileWriterBuilder

        public TasmFileWriterBuilder(File outputTasmFile)
        Create a new Builder which will build a TasmWriter that will write its data to the given output file.
        Parameters:
        outputTasmFile - the output File to write the data to; can not be null. If this file already exists, then the old data will be overwritten, if this file does not exist or if any parent directories for this file do not exist, then they will be created when the TasmWriter is built.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if outputTasmFile is null.

      • TasmFileWriterBuilder

        public TasmFileWriterBuilder(OutputStream out)
        Create a new Builder which will build a TasmWriter that will write its data to the given OutputStream.
        Parameters:
        out - theOutputStream to write the data to; can not be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if outputTasmFile is null.

    • Method Detail

      • writeAnnotationContigs

        public TasmFileWriterBuilder writeAnnotationContigs()
        Configure the TasmWriter to write "TIGR annotation contigs" which are used by the annotation teams. This type of contig differs from a normal contig, in that the annotation contig only has the consensus and related metadata, the underlying read information is not included in the tasm output. This method should only be used internally by JCVI since only internal JCVI utilities require annotation tasm files.
        Returns:
        this

      • build

        Description copied from interface: Builder

        Returns:
        a new instance of T.
